Container.Name: CloudBerryBackup
Container.Overview: Backup files and folders to cloud storage of your choice: Amazon S3, Azure Blob Storage, Google Cloud Storage, HP Cloud, Rackspace Cloud Files, OpenStack, DreamObjects and other.[br][br]The graphical user interface (GUI) is accessible through a modern web browser or via any VNC client. Also, being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small (about 60MB in download size).

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where CloudBerry Backup stores its configuration, log and any files needing persistency.<br> Container path: /config

Config.Name: Storage
Config.Description: This is where files and folders to backup are located.<br> Container path: /storage

Config.Name: Flash
Config.Description: This is where data on your unRAID flash device is located. Useful to backup your unRAID configuration.<br> Container path: /flash

Config.Name: Unassigned Devices
Config.Description: This is where unassigned devices are located.<br> Container path: /unassigned

Config.Name: Display Width
Config.Description: Width, in pixels, of CloudBerry Backup's application window.

Config.Name: Display Height
Config.Description: Height, in pixels, of CloudBerry Backup's application window.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user CloudBerry Backup runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group CloudBerry Backup runs as.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which CloudBerry Backup should run. A niceness value of −20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.<br> <b>NOTE:</b> Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, <i><b>--cap-add=SYS_NICE</b></i> must be added in <i>Extra Parameters</i> (shown when <i>Advanced View</i> is enabled).

Config.Name: WEB Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the CloudBerry Backup GUI with a web browser.

Config.Name: VNC Port for GUI
Config.Description: Port used to access the CloudBerry Backup GUI with VNC client.<br> Make sure this port is equal to the WEB GUI port + 100.
